revised_title: Effects of Secondary Flow on Laminar Dispersion in Curved Tubes
tldr: The article investigates the effects of secondary flow on the laminar dispersion of an injected substance in a curved tube. The authors extend the iterative Fourier-series solution of Dean's simplified Navier-Stokes equations to calculate the dispersion and compare their results with experimental measurements and theoretical work. The study shows that secondary flow can produce a more uniform distribution of velocity over the fluid than in Poiseuille flow, and it highlights the importance of convection in the dispersion process.
